alert.note: Alert for Idaho Palouse (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 04 at 8:31PM MST until January 06 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...LIGHT TO MODERATE SNOW TONIGHT FOLLOWED BY HEAVY SNOW WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO THURSDAY... .A weak weather system will spread light to moderate snow across the Cascade crest and over southeast Washington into the southern to central Idaho Panhandle overnight. This is expected to result in a slippery drive for the Wednesday morning commute. A stronger and wetter storm system will arrive Wednesday night with heavy snow and mixed precipitation possible for much of eastern Washington and the Idaho Panhandle. Major disruptions to travel will be possible, including the Thursday morning commute. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM PST WEDNESDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY EVENING THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Snow accumulations of 2 to 3 inches. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations between 4 and 8 inches possible. * WHERE...Potlatch, Rosalia, Plummer, Colfax, Tekoa, Moscow, Genesee, Uniontown, La Crosse, Pullman, and Oakesdale. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 6 AM PST Wednesday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Wednesday evening through Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Slippery travel expected for the Wednesday morning commute. Travel could be very difficult Wednesday night through Thursday with hazardous conditions impacting the Thursday morning commute and possibly the Thursday evening commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on the heavy snow and mix precipitation situation for Wednesday night through Thursday.
